workflow.name: Automate Google Ads search term analysis with Gemini AI and send to Slack
workflow.description:
# Automate Google Ads Search Term Analysis and Send Insights to Slack

Stop manually digging through endless Google Ads search term reports! ðŸ“Š This workflow puts your brand campaign analysis on autopilot, acting as an AI-powered performance marketer that works for you 24/7.

This template fetches your recent search term data, uses AI to identify wasted ad spend and new keyword opportunities, and delivers a concise, actionable report directly to your Slack channelâ€”complete with buttons to approve the changes.

## âš™ï¸ How it works
This workflow connects to your Google Ads account to pull search term data from your brand campaigns. It then feeds this data to Google Gemini with a specific prompt to:
- Identify Non-Brand Keywords: Isolate all search terms that are not related to your brand.
- Calculate Wasted Spend: Find terms with zero conversions and sum up the total cost.
- Flag Opportunities: Highlight non-brand terms that are converting for manual review.
- Send to Slack: Format the findings into a beautiful, easy-to-read Slack message with interactive buttons to approve adding the wasteful terms as negative keywords.

## ðŸ‘¥ Whoâ€™s it for?
- PPC & SEM Managers: Save hours each week by automating the search query mining process.
- Performance Marketers: Instantly spot and plug budget leaks in your brand campaigns.
- Digital Marketing Agencies: Provide proactive, data-driven insights to clients with zero manual effort.

## ðŸ› ï¸ How to set up
This is an advanced workflow that requires several connection points.

Setup involves connecting your Google Ads account, providing your Manager and Client IDs, specifying which campaign and brand terms to analyze, configuring the direct API call with your developer token, and finally connecting your Slack workspace.

ðŸ‘‰ For a detailed, step-by-step guide, please refer to the yellow sticky note inside the workflow.

workflow.name: Automate Google Ads Search Term Analysis and Send Insights to Slack

channelId.value: INSERT YOUR SLACK CHANNEL ID HERE

messageValues.message:
=Act as a Google Ads SEM performance marketer. Your job is to analyze the provided data and generate a report in a standardized JSON format.

Context:
{{ $json.brand_info }}

Objective:

Analyze search term data from the company's brand campaigns over the past 14 days to identify non-brand keywords.

Your analysis must follow these strict rules:
Identify all search terms NOT directly related to the company/brand.

Categorize these non-brand terms into two groups based on the conversions metric only (ignore allConversions).

Group A (Wastage): Terms with ZERO conversions. These will be added to the negativeKeywords list.

Group B (For Review): Terms with ONE OR MORE conversions. These will be added to the keywordsForReview list.

Calculate totalAdWastageUSD using the cost from Group A only.

The output structure must be strictly followed to ensure it can be processed automatically.

Time Now: {{ $now.setZone("Asia/Singapore") }}

Output Format (Strict JSON):
Return the final result strictly in the following JSON structure. Both recommendations and keywordsForReview must always be included as arrays. If there are no items for a list, return an empty array [].

{
  "reportTitle": "string",
  "date": "YYYY-MM-DD",
  "period": "string (e.g., '2025-10-28 to 2025-11-05')",
  "totalAdWastageUSD": "number",
  "summary": "string",
  "recommendations": [
    {
      "campaign": "string",
      "campaignId": "string",
      "adGroup": "string",
      "adGroupId": "string",
      "negativeKeywords": ["string", "string"]
    }
  ],
  "keywordsForReview": [
    {
      "searchTerm": "string",
      "campaign": "string",
      "adGroup": "string",
      "costUSD": "number",
      "conversions": "number",
      "reason": "string"
    }
  ]
}

nodes.name: Filtering For A Specific Search Google Campaign
Extracting Search Terms In The Past 14 Days

parameters.url: https://googleads.googleapis.com/v19/customers/(INSERT YOUR GOOGLE ADS ACCOUNT ID HERE)/googleAds:search

parameters.name: query
parameters.value:
=SELECT
    search_term_view.search_term,
    search_term_view.status,
    metrics.impressions,
    metrics.clicks,
    metrics.cost_micros,
    metrics.all_conversions,
    metrics.conversions,
    campaign.name,
    ad_group.name,
    ad_group.id,
    segments.date
FROM
    search_term_view
WHERE
    campaign.id = {{ $json.id }}
    AND segments.date DURING LAST_14_DAYS
    AND metrics.clicks > 1
ORDER BY
    metrics.clicks DESC
LIMIT 1000

parameters.name: login-customer-id
parameters.value: PASTE YOUR MCC ACCOUNT ID HERE

nodes.name: Split Out HTTP Request Into Individual Items

conditions.rightValue: (INSERT YOUR BRAND TERM HERE - THIS IS TO ENSURE IT IS EXCLUDED FROM THE LLM TO ANALYZE TO SAVE ON TOKEN USAGE)

nodes.name: Aggregating Items To Prepare For LLM To Analyze
Transforming It It To Be Ready For Slack Block

parameters.content:
## Automate Google Ads Search Term Analysis and Send Insights to Slack

This workflow is your AI assistant for managing Google Ads brand campaigns. It automatically fetches search term data, uses AI to find non-brand keywords that are wasting your budget, and sends a clear, actionable report to Slack.

## âš ï¸ This is an advanced workflow
This template uses a direct HTTP Request to the Google Ads API for maximum data retrieval. This requires you to have a Google Ads Developer Token.

## What it does
1.  **Fetch Data:** Connects to your Google Ads account and pulls all search term data from a specific brand campaign over the last 14 days.
2.  **Clean & Aggregate:** The workflow cleans up the raw API data, removes your known brand terms, and aggregates the performance metrics for each unique search term.
3.  **AI Analysis:** It sends the cleaned data to Google Gemini, which acts as an SEM expert to identify two key groups:
    *   **Wastage:** Non-brand keywords with 0 conversions that should be added as negatives.
    *   **For Review:** Non-brand keywords that *are* converting and need a human decision.
4.  **Report to Slack:** The AI's findings are formatted into a professional Slack message, including the total wasted ad spend and interactive buttons to approve adding the negative keywords in a follow-up workflow.

## How to set up
1.  **Connect Google Ads:**
    *   In the "Getting Google Campaigns" node, connect your Google Ads account and enter your **Manager Customer ID** and **Client Customer ID**.
    *   In the "Filtering For A Specific Search Google Campaign" node, enter the name of the brand campaign you want to analyze.
2.  **Configure the API Call:**
    *   In the "Extracting Search Terms..." (HTTP Request) node, you **must** update four things:
        *   The Google Ads Account ID in the **URL**.
        *   Your **Developer Token** in the headers.
        *   Your **MCC Account ID** in the headers.
        *   Connect your Google Ads account in the **Authentication** tab.
3.  **Define Your Brand:**
    *   In the "Removing Brand Terms..." node, enter your core brand name to exclude it from the analysis.
    *   In the "Edit Fields" node, provide a short `brand_info` description for the AI's context.
4.  **Connect AI & Slack:**
    *   In the "Google Gemini Chat Model" node, connect your Gemini API credentials.
    *   In the "Send a message" (Slack) node, connect your Slack account and select the channel where you want to receive the report.

**ðŸ‘‡ STEP 1: GOOGLE ADS SETUP**

Configure your Google Ads connection here.

**Action Required:**
1.  In **"Getting Google Campaigns"**, connect your credentials and add your Manager & Client IDs.
2.  In **"Filtering For A Specific Search..."**, enter the name of the brand campaign you want to analyze.

**âš ï¸ STEP 2: ADVANCED API CALL**

This is the most critical step. This node calls the Google Ads API directly.

**Action Required:**
1.  Update the Google Ads Account ID in the **URL**.
2.  In **Headers**, paste your **Developer Token** and **MCC Account ID**.
3.  In **Authentication**, select your Google Ads credential.

**ðŸŽ¯ STEP 3: DEFINE YOUR BRAND**

Tell the workflow what to ignore and give the AI context.

**Action Required:**
1.  In the **"Removing Brand Terms..."** node, enter your brand name so it's excluded from the analysis.
2.  In the **"Brand Info"** node, write a short sentence about your company for the `brand_info` field.

**ðŸš€ STEP 4: CONFIGURE OUTPUT**

Set up your AI and Slack connections to finish.

**Action Required:**
1.  Connect your **Google Gemini** credentials in the model node.
2.  In the **"Send a message"** node, connect your Slack account and choose the channel for the report.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
